snippet: The first excursions by new airlines that will take tourists out of Earth’s atmosphere are poised to take off in 2012.
abstract: Virgin Galactic intends to start offering flights just beyond the space barrier on a rocket ship it has built, with seats priced at $200,000; at least two other specialty airlines plan to offer such flights as well, and insurance company Allianz will introduce insurance products for space travel, lending space tourism the trappings of the regular travel industry.
lead_paragraph: The first excursions by new airlines that will take tourists out of Earth’s atmosphere are poised to take off in 2012.
